com.caseybrooks.androidbibletools.basic

Class Passage<T extends Verse>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.caseybrooks.androidbibletools.basic.AbstractVerse
      • com.caseybrooks.androidbibletools.basic.Passage<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of Verse that is contained in this Passage's list of verses
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<AbstractVerse>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ABSPassage, CJBPassage, OpenBiblePassage, SimplePassage

    public abstract class Passage<T extends Verse>
extends AbstractVerse
    A base class for a list of Verses of a particular type. As with all implementations of AbstractVerse, the Reference is immutable, and so this passage will always refer to the same set of verses within one chapter of the Bible. In most cases, you will want to primarily use some implementation of Passage as opposed to Verse, because it is more powerful, but when set with just a single verse, acts very similar to the Verse class.
    See Also:
    Verse

      • verses

    • Constructor Detail

      • Passage

        public Passage(Reference reference)
        Create this Passage with the given Reference. Upon creation, an unmodifiable list of Verses will be created of the type specified by the type parameter T. As of now, this feature is buggy, and does not work with any deeper subclasses of Passage. As such, only direct descendants of Passage should be created, and those implementations should always be final classes.
        Parameters:
        reference - the reference of this Passage

      • getText

        public java.lang.String getText()
        Description copied from class: AbstractVerse
        Get the unformatted text of this verse. In addition to not using the Formatter for output, it if likely that the text of implementing classes will contain markup that will be given with this method. This might be useful for display if that markup is simple HTML markup.
        Specified by:

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(AbstractVerse verse)
        Description copied from class: AbstractVerse
        Compare two AbstractVerses. Each implementation is responsible for deciding whether that AbstractVerse implementation can be sorted with any other implementation, and if so, how that comparison should work. Refer to the documentation of any implementing classes to see how it is handled.
